parts.text: {"word":"space","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"空間、場所、余地、スペース","english_definition":"an area that is empty or available for use.","examples":[{"sentence":"There isn't enough space in the car for all our luggage.","translation":"私たちの荷物を全部入れるだけのスペースが車にはありません。"},{"sentence":"We need more space to store these boxes.","translation":"これらの箱を保管するためにもっとスペースが必要です。"},{"sentence":"The children were playing in the open space.","translation":"子供たちは空き地で遊んでいた。"}],"collocations":["parking space (駐車スペース)","living space (居住空間)","storage space (保管スペース)","open space (空き地)","head space (頭上空間)","breathing space (余裕、ゆとり)","personal space (パーソナルスペース)"],"synonyms":["room","area","volume","capacity","extent","scope"],"antonyms":["confinement","restriction","limitation"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"宇宙、宇宙空間","english_definition":"the physical universe beyond the earth's atmosphere.","examples":[{"sentence":"Scientists are exploring space.","translation":"科学者たちは宇宙を探査している。"},{"sentence":"The first man in space was Yuri Gagarin.","translation":"宇宙に行った最初の人類はユーリ・ガガーリンだった。"},{"sentence":"Space travel is becoming more common.","translation":"宇宙旅行はより一般的になりつつある。"}],"collocations":["outer space (宇宙空間)","space exploration (宇宙探査)","space travel (宇宙旅行)","space station (宇宙ステーション)","space shuttle (スペースシャトル)","spacecraft (宇宙船)","space age (宇宙時代)"],"synonyms":["cosmos","universe","outer space","the heavens"],"antonyms":["earth","atmosphere"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"(活字の)空白、スペース","english_definition":"a blank area between words, letters, or other things.","examples":[{"sentence":"Leave a space after each word.","translation":"各単語の後にスペースを空けてください。"},{"sentence":"There should be a space between the name and the address.","translation":"名前と住所の間にはスペースが必要です。"},{"sentence":"The software automatically inserts a space after each sentence.","translation":"そのソフトウェアは各文の後に自動的にスペースを挿入します。"}],"collocations":["single space (シングルスペース)","double space (ダブルスペース)","hard space (改行されないスペース)","non-breaking space (改行されないスペース)"],"synonyms":["gap","interval","blank","void","pause"],"antonyms":["character","letter"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"間隔をあける、スペースを空ける","english_definition":"to arrange things with spaces between them.","examples":[{"sentence":"Space the plants evenly in the garden.","translation":"庭に植物を均等な間隔で植えてください。"},{"sentence":"Space the chairs around the table.","translation":"テーブルの周りに椅子を間隔をあけて配置してください。"},{"sentence":"The text is spaced too closely together.","translation":"テキストの間隔が狭すぎる。"}],"collocations":["space out (間隔をあける、ぼんやりする)","evenly spaced (均等に間隔があけられた)","widely spaced (広く間隔があけられた)"],"synonyms":["separate","arrange","distribute","position"],"antonyms":["crowd","compress","condense"]}],"etymology":{"value":"古フランス語の「espace」から派生し、ラテン語の「spatium」（空間、距離、期間）に由来する。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/speɪs/","syllables":"space"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"spaces","verb_forms":{"present_simple":["space","spaces"],"past_simple":"spaced","past_participle":"spaced","present_participle":"spacing"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**space**」は、物理的な「空間」や「場所」を指す最も一般的な意味の他に、「宇宙空間」や、文字間の「空白」など、文脈によって様々な意味を持ちます。動詞としては「間隔をあける」という意味で使用されます。また、派生語や句動詞も多く存在し、幅広い場面で使用される単語です。","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ I need a space to park my car in the street.","correct":"✓ I need a space to park my car on the street.","note":"「通りに駐車する」は "on the street" が一般的です。"},{"incorrect":"✗ There is not many space in my bag.","correct":"✓ There is not much space in my bag.","note":"「space」は不可算名詞なので、"many" ではなく "much" を使用します。"},{"incorrect":"✗ He spaced out during the meeting because he was tired.","correct":"✓ He spaced out during the meeting because he was tired.","note":"句動詞 "space out" は、「ぼんやりする」「上の空になる」という意味です。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["spacious (形容詞: 広々とした)","spacing (名詞: 間隔、スペーシング)","spacecraft (名詞: 宇宙船)","spaceship (名詞: 宇宙船)","spaceport (名詞: 宇宙港)","space station (名詞: 宇宙ステーション)","space shuttle (名詞: スペースシャトル)"],"phrasal_verbs":["space out (間隔をあける、ぼんやりする)"],"idioms_phrases":["watch this space (乞うご期待)","in the space of (～の間に)","take up space (場所を取る)","create space (スペースを作る)","make space (スペースを作る)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"A2 (基本的な意味「空間」)、B1 (宇宙空間、動詞としての使用)","frequency_google_ngram":"非常に高頻度 (Very high frequency) - 英語のコア語彙の一つ。","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"「**space**」は、いくつかの意味を持つ一般的な単語です。一番よくあるのは、何かを入れたり、何かをするための「場所」や「空間」を指すことです。例えば、「Is there enough **space** for everyone?（みんなが入るのに十分なスペースはありますか？）」のように使います。また、「宇宙」という意味もあります。さらに、文字や単語の間の「空白」を指すこともあります。動詞としては、「間隔をあける」という意味で使われます。文脈によって意味が変わるので、注意しましょう。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The new office has plenty of **space**.","translation":"新しいオフィスには十分なスペースがある。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"空間、場所"},{"sentence":"Humans have always been fascinated by **space**.","translation":"人類は常に宇宙に魅了されてきた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"宇宙"},{"sentence":"Remember to leave a **space** between each word.","translation":"各単語の間にスペースを空けることを忘れないでください。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"空白"},{"sentence":"Please **space** the chairs evenly around the table.","translation":"テーブルの周りに椅子を均等な間隔で配置してください。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"間隔をあける"},{"sentence":"He needs some **space** to think about his future.","translation":"彼は自分の将来について考えるための時間（余裕）が必要だ。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"余裕、時間"}]}
